alert.note: Alert for Delta; Luce; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 31 at 4:14AM EDT until April 01 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT /10 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch through this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations in excesss of 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible with the heavy snow tonight. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, especially near Lake Superior. * WHERE...Luce, Menominee, Delta, Southern Schoolcraft and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM EDT /10 AM CDT/ this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact multiple morning and evening commutes through Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Delta; Luce; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft
